ETYMOLOGY: From Medieval Latin tonsilla (plural tonsillae), possibly diminutive of Latin tonsa 'oar', but the primary usage refers directly to the anatomical structure as designated in the Middle Ages.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Either of two small masses of lymphoid tissue situated on each side of the back of the throat (pharynx), which act as part of the body's immune defense system.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 扁桃体，位于咽喉后部两侧的淋巴组织团块，是身体免疫防御系统的一部分。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: When his tonsils became infected, he was diagnosed with tonsillitis.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 当他的扁桃体被感染时，他被诊断患有扁桃体炎。
